column4: whn i use free -m, it tells me i have no swap, although i have "/dev/hda3       none            swap    sw              0       0" on my fstab
cool - so you actually have no swap - maybe you'd like to configure some...
i have a partition formated as swap, and the ""/dev/hda3       none            swap    sw              0       0", what else should i do?
you DEAD sure there's no useful data on /dev/hda3  ???
ok, at your peril, we'll make the swapfs   -  'sudo mkswap /dev/hda3'
ok, the swap is on now... but is it gonna be on when i restart too?
the fstab looks good, so 99% likely yes
than why did it happen? anyway, ill restart in some minutes and will let u know if happens again...
you didn't have the swapfs on the partition
what do u mean? when i installed ubuntu i checked that partition as swap, what did i do wrong?
mkswap is a way of 'formatting' a partition so the swapfs driver can use it
ok thanks... ill restart now and ill see what will happen...
k thanks. it worked. thank u very much... :)
